definition: poor wretch/pauper/destitute man/poverty-stricken peasant/penniless good-for-nothing/impecunious vagabond
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
egg/CL:個|个[ge4],打[da2]/oval-shaped thing
variant of 蜑[Dan4]

sentences.english: Maybe we would be friends but Japan would be bancrupt.
sentences.chinese: 或許我們可以做朋友，但日本會變成窮光蛋的。

sentences.english: Will you tell me where you are going, you wretch?
sentences.chinese: 你到底說不說你要去什麼地方，窮光蛋？

sentences.english: And, of course, when he died, he didn't die a pauper.
sentences.chinese: 當然，他臨終時並非是個窮光蛋。

sentences.english: But I don't need your advice. Do you think Pa is a pauper ?
sentences.chinese: 不過我不需要你的忠告，你認爲我爸是個窮光蛋嗎？

sentences.english: The only people who say money does not happiness are the pathetic broke individuals who do not have it.
sentences.chinese: 而只有那些一文不名的窮光蛋纔會說有錢並不幸福。
他們嘲笑他是個窮光蛋。

sentences.english: Paupers we are, and paupers we shall remain.
sentences.chinese: 我們的確是窮光蛋，而且還會繼續是窮光蛋。

sentences.english: Paupers we are, and paupers we shall remain.
sentences.chinese: 我們的確是窮光蛋，而且還會繼續是窮光蛋。

sentences.english: He wanted to make Aladdin poor again.
sentences.chinese: 他想再把阿拉丁變成窮光蛋。

sentences.english: Go away and don't come the old soldier in my pub again.
sentences.chinese: 走開，別裝窮光蛋再來我酒館裏討喝的。

sentences.english: He is a fellow of the pauper.
Even being a broke-ass kid in the city, I do not regret that purchase one bit.
sentences.chinese: 即使是這個城市的窮光蛋，我也不後悔買了那張碟。

sentences.english: He is a skint guy , and I won't marry him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個窮光蛋，我不會和他結婚。

sentences.english: Where would the dirt-poor Tom get a hundred dollars?
sentences.chinese: 湯姆這個窮光蛋到哪兒弄一百元去？

sentences.english: 'I can't go to the show tonight, I'm ass out. '
sentences.chinese: 我沒法去那演唱會了，我光屁股，一窮光蛋。

definition: lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: to be self-interested
wealthy son-in-law/wealthy husband
having nothing better to do
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
unfortunately cannot enjoy (idiom)
vain
reckless/extremely daring
to make fun of/to seek diversion
